content: wheat stitch pumpkin designed by ann moss skill level easy approximate finished sizes small 3 inches tall 3 5 inches across and 12 inches around medium 4 5 inches tall 5 inches across and 14 inches around large 5 5 inches tall 5 5 inches across and 17 inches around us terminology materials hook size i 5 5 mm yarn needle small amount of poly-fil embellishments and scissors yarn yardage size 4 yarn approximately 80 yards for small 95 yards for medium and 110 yards for large abbreviations beg=beginning chain=chain chs=chains ea-each repeat=repeat blo-back loop only single_crochet=single_crochet scs=single crochets skip=skip st=stitch sts=stitches space=space yo=yarn over special stitches modified puff skip the first stitch single_crochet in the next stitch working in the skipped stitch yarn over insert in skipped stitch yarn over pull back through yarn over insert in same skipped stitch yarn over pull back through 5 loops on hook yarn over pull through 4 loops yarn over pull through last 2 loops pattern chain 17 23 27 row 1 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from the hook 1 single_crochet in ea chain across 16 22 26 scs row 2 & 3 chain 1 turn 1 single_crochet blo in ea of the next 2 sts complete 6 9 11 modified puff stitches until 2 sts are left in the row 1 single_crochet blo in ea of the next 2 sts row 4 & 5 chain 1 turn 1 single_crochet blo in ea st across 16 22 26 scs in blos repeat row 2 through 5 6 7 8 more times cut yarn leaving a long tail to sew together fold in half and whip stitch in blo of last row and in the beg chain stitch tie a knot and continue to stitch around the ends of the row and pull tight to close tie off and weave in ends stuff with poly-fil and with another short piece of yarn whip stitch around the other ends of the row and pull tight to close into a round shape embellish with stick for pumpkin stem ribbon and leaves
